required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Methyl-donor Nutrient Supplementation and Methylation Profile in Lupus Patients With Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Methyl-donor Nutrient Supplementation on Methylation Profile of Inflammatory-related Genes in Lupus Patients With Obesity: a Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Dietary supplementation with methyl donors has been demonstrated to increase DNA methylation in leucocytes whereas a limited dietary intake of methyl donors was associated with DNA hypomethylation. Considering SLE disease, previously study showed that high doses of vitamin B6 and folate were associated with less severe SLE. Furthermore, some evidences reported a relatively high incidence of decreased serum B12 levels in rheumatic patients. This led to the suggestion that diets rich in methyl group donors could have beneficial effects on SLE.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on DNA methylation profile at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on weight at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on serum vitamin B12 concentrations at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Serum vitamin B12 concentrations in pg/mL

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on serum folic acid concentrations at 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Serum folic acid concentrations in ng/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Age of onset
Duration of disease since diagnosis
Change from baseline on miR-146 expression at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on miR-181 expression at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on miR-21 expression at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on miR-126 expression at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on DNMT3 gene expression at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on DNMT1 gene expression at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on global DNA hydroxymethylation at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of global DNA hydroxymethylation level

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on serum leptin concentrations at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on serum C-reactive protein concentrations at 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Serum C-reactive protein concentration in ng/mL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline on serum adipokines concentrations at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on serum triglycerides concentrations at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on serum cholesterol concentrations at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on serum glucose concentrations at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on dietary intake at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on abdominal circumference at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on fat mass at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on body mass index at 12 weeks
Change from baseline on height at 12 weeks

intervention.description: A 12 weeks parallel-group randomised controlled trial will be performed, in which erythematous lupus patients will complete a vitamin B12 and folic acid supplementation, in addition to the usual therapy. The dietary supplementation will be by capsules, which will content 400 mcg of folic acid and 2000 mcg of vitamin B12 each.

A 12 weeks parallel-group randomised controlled trial will be performed, in which erythematous lupus patients will complete a placebo supplementation.The placebo and vitamin B12 + folic acid supplement will be indistinguishable in terms of taste, smell, and appearance.

criteria.textblock:
- Female
Inclusion criteria:
- In pre-menopausal period
- Aged between 18 to 40 years
- Patients that meet the classification criteria according to Systemic Lupus International Collaborating Clinics classification criteria (SLICC)
- Patients with SLEDAI score ≤ 4 on Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index 2000 (SLEDAI-2K)
- Under glucocorticoid treatment at a dosage <10 mg/day
- Under treatment with chloroquine at a stable dose
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infection
- Diabetes
- Smokers
- Pregnancy
